item.title: LCD Soundsystem’s ‘All My Friends’ Music Video Remade Using LEGO
item.dc:creator: Kimber Streams
item.description: Editor and animator Michael J. Green has recreated the music video for “All My Friends” by LCD Soundsystem using LEGO characters and bricks. Here’s the orignal music video for comparison. video #1 via Michael J. Green, video #2 via EMI Music via Nerdcore
item.content:encoded:
Editor and animator Michael J. Green has recreated the music video for “All My Friends” by LCD Soundsystem using LEGO characters and bricks. Here’s the orignal music video for comparison.

video #1 via Michael J. Green, video #2 via EMI Music

via Nerdcore

item.title: Street Artist Improves ‘The Wolverine’ Movie Poster Ad by Adding Claw Slashes to Surrounding Posters
item.dc:creator: Justin Page
item.description: New York City-based street artist Poster Boy has “improved” a movie poster advertisement (photo 2) in the Carroll Street subway station in Brooklyn for The Wolverine, a newly released superhero film, by adding claw slashes to surrounding posters. photos by Poster Boy via BuzzFeed, UPROXX, Neaotorama
item.content:encoded:
New York City-based street artist Poster Boy has “improved” a movie poster advertisement (photo 2) in the Carroll Street subway station in Brooklyn for The Wolverine, a newly released superhero film, by adding claw slashes to surrounding posters.

photos by Poster Boy

via BuzzFeed, UPROXX, Neaotorama

item.title: A Live Action Movie Spoof of ‘Daria’ Featuring Aubrey Plaza From ‘Parks and Recreation’
item.dc:creator: Justin Page
item.description: Aubrey Plaza, who plays April Ludgate on the NBC comedy series Parks and Recreation, stars as Daria Morgendorffer, in CollegeHumor’s live action spoof of the of MTV animated series Daria. Daria Morgendorffer returns to Lawndale and discovers her shallow classmates have grown into shallow adults.
item.content:encoded:
Aubrey Plaza, who plays April Ludgate on the NBC comedy series Parks and Recreation, stars as Daria Morgendorffer, in CollegeHumor’s live action spoof of the of MTV animated series Daria.

Daria Morgendorffer returns to Lawndale and discovers her shallow classmates have grown into shallow adults.

item.title: Unwritten Social Rules You Need to Follow
item.dc:creator: Justin Page
item.description: 2. Chew with your mouth closed. No one needs to hear you crunching. “This is the most important thing you’ll read all day.” BuzzFeed senior editor Dave Stopera has compiled a list of 33 Unwritten Rules Everyone Needs To Follow. The collection of helpful tips was gathered by Dave from a thread on reddit. You [...]
item.content:encoded:
2. Chew with your mouth closed. No one needs to hear you crunching.

“This is the most important thing you’ll read all day.”

BuzzFeed senior editor Dave Stopera has compiled a list of 33 Unwritten Rules Everyone Needs To Follow. The collection of helpful tips was gathered by Dave from a thread on reddit. You can view them all online.

Here is a video from BuzzFeed featuring 12 more unwritten rules:

10. Always leave a one-urinal buffer zone.

17. Replace toilet paper after you finish it.

25. Don’t be the big plug guy.

26. Or be this person on Facebook.

images and video via BuzzFeed

item.title: A Bike That Both Dispenses & Pops Bubble Wrap As You Ride It
item.dc:creator: Rusty Blazenhoff
item.description: Los Angeles-based “comedy imaginator” Eric Buss has invented the Bubble Wrap Bike, a bicycle outfitted to hold, dispense and pop bubble wrap as it’s ridden. In this video shot by Chris Gongora, Buss shows how it works and it’s no exaggeration to say that his invention is truly a beautiful, albeit noisy, thing. via reddit, [...]
item.content:encoded:
Los Angeles-based “comedy imaginator” Eric Buss has invented the Bubble Wrap Bike, a bicycle outfitted to hold, dispense and pop bubble wrap as it’s ridden. In this video shot by Chris Gongora, Buss shows how it works and it’s no exaggeration to say that his invention is truly a beautiful, albeit noisy, thing.

via reddit, Daily Picks and Flicks

item.title: Clown Sleeping While Sitting on a NYC Park Bench Is Actually Part of the Lightness of Being Public Art Installation
item.dc:creator: Scott Beale
item.description: If you are in City Hall Park in New York City, you might happen upon a colorful “big-bellied” clown sleeping while sitting on a park bench. It’s a performance piece by New York artist Ugo Rondinone called “Dog Days are Over” created in collaboration with fashion designer Victoria Bartlett. This performance piece, along with many [...]
item.content:encoded:
If you are in City Hall Park in New York City, you might happen upon a colorful “big-bellied” clown sleeping while sitting on a park bench. It’s a performance piece by New York artist Ugo Rondinone called “Dog Days are Over” created in collaboration with fashion designer Victoria Bartlett. This performance piece, along with many sculptural installations in the area, are part of the public art exhibition “Lightness of Being” presented by Public Art Fund in City Hall Park which runs through December 13.

photo by Scott Beale

item.title: Super Heroes & Sesame Street Characters Sitting on Citi Bikes
item.dc:creator: Scott Beale
item.description: Walking up Centre Street in New York City today we came across a curious assortment of super heroes and Sesame Street characters sitting on docked Citi Bikes. Not sure what this was all about, but it was quite amusing to see. photo by Scott Beale
item.content:encoded:
Walking up Centre Street in New York City today we came across a curious assortment of super heroes and Sesame Street characters sitting on docked Citi Bikes. Not sure what this was all about, but it was quite amusing to see.

photo by Scott Beale

item.title: Baitogogo, Tangled Branch Installation at the Palais de Tokyo in Paris
item.dc:creator: EDW Lynch
item.description: “Baitogogo” by Brazilian artist Henrique Oliveira is an installation of tangled branches that appear to grow directly out of the architecture of the Palais de Tokyo in Paris. The branching structures are made out of tapumes, a Brazilian wood that is used for fences. For more on the installation’s three-month-long construction process, see this making-of [...]
item.content:encoded:
“Baitogogo” by Brazilian artist Henrique Oliveira is an installation of tangled branches that appear to grow directly out of the architecture of the Palais de Tokyo in Paris. The branching structures are made out of tapumes, a Brazilian wood that is used for fences. For more on the installation’s three-month-long construction process, see this making-of video by My Art Agenda. “Baitogogo” is on display until September 9, 2013.

photos by André Morin

via Dark Silence in Suburbia, Colossal

item.title: Dynamite and Detonator Lights
item.dc:creator: EDW Lynch
item.description: German design studio Docstone has created a pair of lights that look like sticks of dynamite with detonators. Mister Boom takes the form of an old-fashioned plunger detonator made of concrete that connects to one or more glass “light bombs.” Little Miss Dynamite features a more modern switch-style detonator that pairs with one to two [...]
item.content:encoded:
German design studio Docstone has created a pair of lights that look like sticks of dynamite with detonators. Mister Boom takes the form of an old-fashioned plunger detonator made of concrete that connects to one or more glass “light bombs.” Little Miss Dynamite features a more modern switch-style detonator that pairs with one to two light bombs. We’re guessing shipping is somewhat awkward for either of them.

via Who Killed Bambi?

item.title: Grumpy Cat Grumppuccino Bottled Coffee Drink Announced
item.dc:creator: Rusty Blazenhoff
item.description: The Official Grumpy Cat Facebook page has announced that the popular internet feline Grumpy Cat will soon have a bottled coffee drink branded with her likeness. The new beverage (which will come in three flavors) is called Grumpy Cat Grumppuccino and its bottle bears a stylized illustration of Grumpy Cat. There’s no information yet on [...]
item.content:encoded:
The Official Grumpy Cat Facebook page has announced that the popular internet feline Grumpy Cat will soon have a bottled coffee drink branded with her likeness. The new beverage (which will come in three flavors) is called Grumpy Cat Grumppuccino and its bottle bears a stylized illustration of Grumpy Cat. There’s no information yet on when or where the product will be available, they simply state: “Coming soon. Seriously. It’s delicious!”

#grumppuccino will come in three flavors! #GrumpyCat pic.twitter.com/XupC46vdqV

— Grumpy Cat (@RealGrumpyCat) July 28, 2013

item.title: Helpful Summertime Life Hacks
item.dc:creator: Rusty Blazenhoff
item.description: The “King of Random” Grant Thompson shares ten helpful summertime life hacks including how to deal with ants with popcorn kernels and how to cleverly cut chunks of mango.
item.content:encoded: The “King of Random” Grant Thompson shares ten helpful summertime life hacks including how to deal with ants with popcorn kernels and how to cleverly cut chunks of mango.

item.title: Ten Thousand Days, Comedy Short About a Man Who Believes He Will Die on His 10,000th Day
item.dc:creator: EDW Lynch
item.description: “Ten Thousand Days” is a dark comedy short about a man who believes he is cursed to die on his 10,000th day, but when the day arrives things don’t go as planned. The film was written and directed by New Zealand-based filmmaker Michael Duignan. submitted via Laughing Squid Tips
item.content:encoded:
“Ten Thousand Days” is a dark comedy short about a man who believes he is cursed to die on his 10,000th day, but when the day arrives things don’t go as planned. The film was written and directed by New Zealand-based filmmaker Michael Duignan.

submitted via Laughing Squid Tips

item.title: High Speed Photo Shows Water Forming Logarithmic Spirals As It Flies Off a Tennis Ball
item.dc:creator: EDW Lynch
item.description: Water forms a series of logarithmic spirals as it flies off a spinning tennis ball this amazing high speed photo captured by photographer Arvin Rahimzadeh. via Colossal
item.content:encoded:
Water forms a series of logarithmic spirals as it flies off a spinning tennis ball this amazing high speed photo captured by photographer Arvin Rahimzadeh.

via Colossal

item.title: Bokehxplosions, Short Film of Beautifully Abstract Fireworks
item.dc:creator: EDW Lynch
item.description: Fireworks appear as abstract constellations of shimmering circles in the beautiful short film “Bokehxplosions” by French artist Stanislas Giroux. Giroux created the abstract effect by manually adjusting focus while he was filming. via Photojojo
item.content:encoded:
Fireworks appear as abstract constellations of shimmering circles in the beautiful short film “Bokehxplosions” by French artist Stanislas Giroux. Giroux created the abstract effect by manually adjusting focus while he was filming.

via Photojojo

item.title: Compilation of Predictions For the Future from Films of the 20s and 30s
item.dc:creator: EDW Lynch
item.description: “1920′s – What The Future Will Look Like” is a compilation of film clips showing how the future will look, as predicted in the 1920s and 1930s. The film was compiled by Aaron1912 back in 2010. via everlasting blort, The Presurfer
item.content:encoded:
“1920′s – What The Future Will Look Like” is a compilation of film clips showing how the future will look, as predicted in the 1920s and 1930s. The film was compiled by Aaron1912 back in 2010.

via everlasting blort, The Presurfer

item.title: Superhero Tan Lines
item.dc:creator: Justin Page
item.description: Canberra, Australia-based illustrator Mike Jacobsen (aka “SeeMikeDraw“) has created “Superhero Tan Lines,” an illustration showing the faces of unmasked comic book superheroes who have been busy fighting crime in the sun. Prints, iPhone cases and skins are available to purchase at Society6. image via Society6 via This Isn’t Happiness
item.content:encoded:
Canberra, Australia-based illustrator Mike Jacobsen (aka “SeeMikeDraw“) has created “Superhero Tan Lines,” an illustration showing the faces of unmasked comic book superheroes who have been busy fighting crime in the sun. Prints, iPhone cases and skins are available to purchase at Society6.

image via Society6

via This Isn’t Happiness

item.title: Rocker Cradle, A Combination Rocking Chair and Cradle
item.dc:creator: EDW Lynch
item.description: The Rocker Cradle is a handcrafted wooden rocking chair with an integrated cradle. Fine woodworker Scott Morrison based the chair on traditional wooden “nanny rockers.” via Well Done Stuff, bookofjoe
item.content:encoded:
The Rocker Cradle is a handcrafted wooden rocking chair with an integrated cradle. Fine woodworker Scott Morrison based the chair on traditional wooden “nanny rockers.”

via Well Done Stuff, bookofjoe

item.title: The Depressed Cake Shop in San Francisco Pop-Up Will Sell Gray Pastries to Support Mental Health
item.dc:creator: EDW Lynch
item.description: The Depressed Cake Shop, a pop-up bakery that sells only gray pastries in order to raise awareness about mental illness, is coming to San Francisco on August 3, 2013. Proceeds will benefit Queer Lifespace, a San Francisco-based counseling agency. We recently posted about another Depressed Cake Shop pop-up that is coming to London on August [...]
item.content:encoded:
The Depressed Cake Shop, a pop-up bakery that sells only gray pastries in order to raise awareness about mental illness, is coming to San Francisco on August 3, 2013. Proceeds will benefit Queer Lifespace, a San Francisco-based counseling agency. We recently posted about another Depressed Cake Shop pop-up that is coming to London on August 2, 2013. The Depressed Cake Shop is organized by Miss Cakehead.

submitted via Laughing Squid Tips

photo via The Depressed Cake Shop SF

item.title: Crazy Barbershop Music Video for ‘It’s You’ by Duck Sauce
item.dc:creator: EDW Lynch
item.description: An inner city barbershop is transformed into a surreal dance party in this delightfully bizarre music video for “It’s You” by Duck Sauce. The video was directed by Phil Andelman and the “hair-raising” visual effects are by Royal Post. via Vimeo Staff Picks
item.content:encoded:
An inner city barbershop is transformed into a surreal dance party in this delightfully bizarre music video for “It’s You” by Duck Sauce. The video was directed by Phil Andelman and the “hair-raising” visual effects are by Royal Post.

via Vimeo Staff Picks

item.title: Nautical Nonsense, An Art Show Tribute to ‘SpongeBob SquarePants’ at Gallery Nucleus in Alhambra, California
item.dc:creator: Justin Page
item.description: “Nautical Nonsense” by Joey Chou Nautical Nonsense is an upcoming group art show at Gallery Nucleus in Alhambra, California that will feature a collection of original artwork honoring Nickelodeon’s animated television series SpongeBob SquarePants. The art show will open on Saturday, July 27, 2013 from 7-11 PM and run through Sunday, August 11, 2013. List [...]
item.content:encoded:
“Nautical Nonsense” by Joey Chou

Nautical Nonsense is an upcoming group art show at Gallery Nucleus in Alhambra, California that will feature a collection of original artwork honoring Nickelodeon’s animated television series SpongeBob SquarePants. The art show will open on Saturday, July 27, 2013 from 7-11 PM and run through Sunday, August 11, 2013.

List of featured artists:

Alex Kirwan, Alina Chau, Amélie Fléchais, Becky Dreistadt, Brigette Barrager, Cuddly Rigor Mortis, Dan Christofferson, Daniela Volpari, Eric Comstock, Eric Diaz, Ginny Hawes, Graham Annable, Felt Mistress, Isreal Sanchez, James Gilleard, Jared Andrew Schorr, Jeff Victor, Joey Chou, John Solimine, Kyle Platts, Meghan Stratman, Michael Fleming, Michelle Romo, Mike Mitchell, Nicole Gustafsson, Oliver Akuin, Perry Maple, Peter Bennett, Peter Emmerich, Robert Ryan Cory, Ryan O’Rourke, Sean Chao, Steve Simpson and TADO.

“Plankton Scream” by Peter Bennett

“Jellyfishin’ With Gary” by Cuddly Rigor Mortis

“Sponge Bob Mutant Pants!” by TADO

“Mr SpongeBob” by Amélie Fléchais

images via Gallery Nucleus and credited artists

via Cartoon Brew

item.title: Arduino and LEGO Projects, A Book Full of Coding, Wiring, and LEGO Crafts by Jon Lazar
item.dc:creator: Kimber Streams
item.description: Arduino and LEGO Projects is a new book by developer Jon Lazar that gives detailed instructions on how to build, wire, and code projects like a TARDIS from Doctor Who that lights up and plays sound, a Karotz-inspired LEGO animal that reacts to Twitter, and an RFID-activated crystal ball that reacts when a hand is [...]
item.content:encoded:
Arduino and LEGO Projects is a new book by developer Jon Lazar that gives detailed instructions on how to build, wire, and code projects like a TARDIS from Doctor Who that lights up and plays sound, a Karotz-inspired LEGO animal that reacts to Twitter, and an RFID-activated crystal ball that reacts when a hand is waved in front of it. Arduino and LEGO Projects is currently available to purchase from Amazon.

image via Jon Lazar

item.title: Ben & Jerry’s Is Making an Ice Cream Based on New York City
item.dc:creator: Kimber Streams
item.description: Ben & Jerry’s is continuing its City Churned campaign — which created a new, but temporary flavor earlier this month for an event in San Francisco — by creating a flavor based on New York City. The new flavor, which has yet to be named, was decided based on the comings and goings of New [...]
item.content:encoded:
Ben & Jerry’s is continuing its City Churned campaign — which created a new, but temporary flavor earlier this month for an event in San Francisco — by creating a flavor based on New York City. The new flavor, which has yet to be named, was decided based on the comings and goings of New York City. For example, every 1, 2, or 3 subway train arriving on time at Times Square counted as a vote for Spoonable Caramel and each on-time 4, 5, or 6 train at Grand Central Station was a vote for waffle cone pieces. The final flavor will include Spoonable caramel, Liddabit sweets, fudge, Sixpoint Brewery, fair trade vanilla ice cream, greyston brownies, fair trade coffee, and is available to taste at various events in New York City on July 26th and 27th.

via Gothamist

item.title: Quick and Simple Life Hacks – Part 10
item.dc:creator: Justin Page
item.description: Household Hacker presents Part 10 of their Quick and Simple Life Hacks series. In this episode they show how to use glass cleaner to kill flies, use your sunglasses as a smart phone stand and more.
item.content:encoded: Household Hacker presents Part 10 of their Quick and Simple Life Hacks series. In this episode they show how to use glass cleaner to kill flies, use your sunglasses as a smart phone stand and more.

item.title: Original ‘Donkey Kong’ Video Game Recreated in Stop Motion
item.dc:creator: Kimber Streams
item.description: Video maker Guiz de Pessemier has recreated the original 1981 Donkey Kong video game in stop motion using characters, props, and a level made entirely of Perler beads on a black sheet. video via Guiz de Pessemier via Kotaku
item.content:encoded:
Video maker Guiz de Pessemier has recreated the original 1981 Donkey Kong video game in stop motion using characters, props, and a level made entirely of Perler beads on a black sheet.

video via Guiz de Pessemier

via Kotaku

item.title: The Lonely Island Performs ‘YOLO’ Live With Jimmy Fallon & The Roots
item.dc:creator: Justin Page
item.description: On Late Night with Jimmy Fallon, the musical comedy group The Lonely Island performed their song “YOLO” live with host Jimmy Fallon and The Roots. Previously, we wrote about The Wack Album, The Lonely Island’s new album that features the original version of “YOLO”. video via The Lonely Island via Gavin Purcell
item.content:encoded:
On Late Night with Jimmy Fallon, the musical comedy group The Lonely Island performed their song “YOLO” live with host Jimmy Fallon and The Roots. Previously, we wrote about The Wack Album, The Lonely Island’s new album that features the original version of “YOLO”.

video via The Lonely Island

via Gavin Purcell
